query: Q51. Where could you analyze the conversion paths users followed across various marketing channels?
options:
Conversions > Goals > Reverse Goal Path
 Conversions > Goals > Funnel Visualization
 Behavior > Behavior Flow
 Conversions > Multi
 Channel Funnels

query: Q52. What does Google Analytics add to the first party cookie to differentiate new from returning visitors?
options:
an HTTP request
 a randomly generated client ID
 a 1x1 tracking pixel
 a SessionStorage object

query: Q53. It is September, and you want to evaluate the most popular page on your site for the month of August. What first steps would you take?
options:
1. Set Date Range to Last 30 Days. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > All Pages.
 1. Set Date Range to Last 30 Days. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > Content Drilldown.
 1. Set Date Range to Last Month. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > Content Drilldown.
 1. Set Date Range to Last Month. 2. Visit Behavior > Site Content > All Pages.

query: Q54. This report is sorted by bounce rate in ascending order. How do you view these results in order of importance instead?
options:
Sort Type: Absolute Change
 Toggle Comparison View
 Sort Type: Weighted Sort
 Use Table Filter

query: Q55. What channel receives attribution if no traffic source data is available?
options:
(Other)
 Direct
 Referral
 Organic Search

query: Q56. Which is an example of a micro goal?
options:
signing up for an account after clicking an ad
 playing a video before signing up
 buying a product after reading an email
 filling out a contact form after reading a social post

query: Q57. What parameter should you use if you were tracking different versions of an ad?
options:
utm_campaign
 utm_medium
 utm_term
 utm_content

query: Q58. The tracking ID contains a string that follows this format: `UA XXXXXX Y`. What does the Y refer to?
options:
the property number
 the account number
 the view number
 It is random.

query: Q59.If a user fills in a contact form and provides an email address, which report would contain that information?
options:
Behavior > Events > Overview
 Acquisition > Social > Form Submissions
 Acquisition > Social > Users Flow
 No report contains this information.

query: Q60.If you want to quickly see what days and times were most popular for visiting your site, what do you do?
options:
Go to Home > Users by time of day (Widget)
 Go to the report at Audience > Cohort Analysis and toggle By Day.
 Go to Behavior > Engagement and toggle Hourly.
 Create a pivot table by Hour on Site Content > All Pages.

query: Q61. If your site does not attribute transactions to the original source, but instead shows all transactions attributed to your payment processor (for example Stripe, PayPal, or Square), how do you remedy this issue?
options:
Switch to Enhanced Ecommerce.
 Use a search and replace filter.
 Create a referral exclusion.
 Add gtag.js to PayPal tags.

query: Q62. What do you use to compare three dimensions?
options:
performance table
 custom reports
 Explorer panel
 relational table

query: Q63. Is it possible to measure how far someone scrolls on a page using Google Analytics? If so, how?
options:
yes, with a calculated metric
 yes, by viewing in page analytics
 yes, with event tracking
 no, not possible

query: Q64. When you enable advertising features, what do you gain access to?
options:
Google Ads data sync
 enhanced UTM tracking
 Google Adsense data sync
 Demographics and Interests reports

query: Q65. Which choice is an example of a micro goal?
options:
playing a video before signing up
 buying a product after reading an email
 filling out a contact form after reading a social post
 signing up for an account after clicking an ad

query: Q65. What is the latest version of the analytics tracking tag?
options:
gtag.js
 urchin.js
 gaq.push and ga.js
 analytics.js

query: Q66. What is an example of a dimension?
options:
Sessions
 Bounce Rate
 Conversions
 Source/Medium

query: Q67. Which report displays the page a visitor arrived on?
options:
Behavior Flow
 Exit Pages
 Landing Pages
 Channels

query: Q68. You are tracking events of playback of video on the home page of a website. You want users who watch the video, but still leave the page with no additional pageviews or interactions, to still be included in the bounce rate calculation. What must be configured?
options:
non-interaction event
 implicit event
 advanced events
 default event

query: Q69. Which attribution model does Google Analytics apply by default for standard reports?
options:
Linear
 First Interaction
 Last Interaction
 Last Non-Direct Click

query: Q70. If you want to track one destination goal but have two URLs that could trigger the goal (for example,/thank-you and /checkout-complete), what approach can you use?
options:
Create a content grouping, and then use the group as the destination.
 Add the additional page as a funnel step.
 Use a regular expression when adding the goal destination.
 That is not possible.

query: Q71. If you created a calculated metric that returned a value of "80" with Time as the formatting type, how would it be represented in Google Analytics?
Q72. You want to compare the revenue, top products, and average order value between people who viewed three or more pages on your site, to those who viewed fewer. What do you do?
options:
Create a custom report where Page Depth is >/3 or Page Depth is <3. Toggle on Revenue, Top Products, and Average Order Value as Dimensions.
 View the Product Performance report and add Page Depth as a secondary dimension. Create a table filter for Page Depth greater than 3 and Page Depth less than 3.
 Create a custom segment where Page Depth is >/3 and another segment where Page Depth is <3. Apply both segments while on the Ecommerce Overview report.
 View the Ecommerce Overview report and create a table filter where Page Depth is >/3 or Page Depth is <3.

query: Q73. If you wanted to create a user-defined metric to measure Revenue per User, what would you use?
options:
ecommerce metrics
 custom dimensions
 calculated metrics
 custom metrics

query: Q74. You are managing analytics for a recipe website that has the following categories: Appetizers, Main Dishes, and Desserts. What do you create in order to compare aggregated data of all recipes in the Appetizer category vs. all recipes in the Desserts category?
options:
custom channels
 advanced filters
 content grouping <= [not sure](https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2853423?hl=en)
 custom segments
